column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: South Carolina

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 2. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: a crossbuck sign.

column2: 3. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: green and white.

column2: 4. When changing lanes, you should never:
column4: look over your shoulder to check blind spots.
column6: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 5. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Turn on your cruise control.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 6. When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates) a driver should look, listen and slow down.
column4: True

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 8. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: pass red lights.

column2: 9. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 10. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 11. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 12. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 14. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You donâ€™t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 15. If you plan to turn at an intersection, you should signal 50 feet before you turn.
column4: True

column2: 16. Alcohol causes:
column4: poor judgment.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 20. This sign indicates:
column4: Phone service ahead

column2: 21. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: yellow warning lights.

column2: 22. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: green, yellow and red

column2: 23. When you see a sign indicating that you are approaching your exit, you should:
column4: signal and move into the exit lane as soon as you reach it.
column6: reduce your speed to the posted exit speed.

column2: 24. You should never park a vehicle:
column4: within 20 feet of a crosswalk.

column2: 25. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 26. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.

column2: 27. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Always.

column2: 28. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 29. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 30. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
